result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: If revoked, consecutive to time currently serving.

Consecutive to: If revoked, conseuctive to time currently serving
Must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.  Firearm warning given.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment or employment to the maximum capacity without affecting Social Security.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by health care provider.  Cooperate with AODA assessment, and recommended treatment and aftercare.

Provide DNA sample as required by law if one has not been provided.  Pay assessed cost of sample.  Cooperate with assessments and follow through with recommended treatment and counseling and aftercare, including cognitive intervention and vocational training.

Preliminary hearing on October 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Joshua J Martin in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Joshua J Martin in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
